alert.note: Alert for Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 02 at 9:45PM EST until December 04 at 8:02PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Sopchoppy River near Sopchoppy (FR 343) affecting Wakulla County. For the Sopchoppy River...including Sopchoppy (FR 343)...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sopchoppy River near Sopchoppy (FR 343). * WHEN...From late tonight to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Water reaches the base of the FR-343 bridge in the Apalachicola National Forest. Access into many areas along the river north of the City of Sopchoppy becomes severely restricted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Saturday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 31.1 feet Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.1 feet on 09/04/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Sunday afternoon at 345 PM EST.
